alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 2:47PM EDT until June 02 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Piscataquis County in north central Maine... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 247 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Guilford, Brownville Junction, Elliottsville, Brownville, Willimantic, Bowerbank, Barnard, Onawa, Katahdin Iron Works and Williamsburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
